text: Sorry for my late response; <@UJ96NAD3P> according to the W3 CSS spec you don't have to close it with a semicolon if there is no new declaration after it.
_A declaration block starts with a left curly brace ({) and ends with the matching right curly brace (}). In between there must be a list of zero or more semicolon-separated (;) declarations._
<@UHNJC3CD7> thanks, that were exactly my thoughts, but ran it through multiple linters and the only "issue" that pops up is the recommendation not to use id's.
